Job Title: Computational Physicist

Location: Amesbury, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
As a step in increasing our efforts in the fields of research and technology development, Munters is now looking for a Computational Physicist to join our research team Physical Modelling and Calculation, PMC in R&D.

In the last three years, a significant effort has been made on theoretical model development of rotor and pad calculation tools. Now we see an increasing need to expand our calculation efforts for Carbon Capture applications in both theoretical and practical aspects. To be ready to for our future challenges we believe that connecting our theoretical findings to the laboratories and customer applications is crucial.

Principal Tasks

 Develop the R&D system design tool for Carbon Capture and VOC application systems to support R&D system development efforts (laboratory performance calculation, mechanical design, connected units’ platform, simulation possibility of new desiccant materials etc.). Utilize our R&D system design and optimization tool for Carbon Capture and VOC applications to categorize customers and identify fields and business cases for potentially new product development. Initiate research efforts in core technology design by Theoretical studies to optimize performance related to specific energy use, sustainability and/or capacity Prototype design and testing to verify the potential of the new core technology Analyze our Carbon Capture products with respect to sustainability and derive technical and economic statistics for sustainability effects in product development. Develop a competitor analysis tool on calculated rotor performance.


Product scope: Carbon Capture and VOC applications.

Interfaces and stakeholders: PMC, R&D, Product Management, Sustainability.

Communication skills: fluency in English

Minimum educational and experience requirements: Master degree in relevant field of engineering (physics or chemical engineering), minimum three years’ of relevant work experience. A doctoral degree within the fields of chemical engineering or engineering physics is a merit.

The Ideal Candidate Would

Have experience and interest from research in the field of process optimization, advanced process calculations, programming and sustainability.Have three to four years of experience with modelling software development in C++ or C#.Take initiatives and responsibility within his/her field.Be innovative (personality) to lead the development in a new field for Munters AirTech.Be a team player who like to work very tight in smaller teams with deadlines to keep.Be a doer that is comfortable with delivering and that has a focus on results.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
